Text:
This land once belonged to the former Viscount
Grease. Now, it is under the rule of a lazy governor
whose management is sorely lacking.

Of course, there's no reason to allocate manpower to
abandoned mines. You introduced us to the perfect
location.

The factory where the counterfeits are being made is
an underground facility between the capital and the
Lawless City.

Long ago, a group of bandits kidnapped Cid's sister
and held her here, and the Shadow Garden hunted
them down. It is an ideal secret base.

When Cid steps inside, he finds that the interior of
the hideout he raided with Alpha and the others
when they were all kids has been completely
transformed into Yukime's counterfeiting factory.

We produce the counterfeits here and then transport
them to the Lawless City.

And then, we create fake circulation channels and
move them to Midgar...

It seems their strategy is to ship the counterfeits
they make here to the Lawless City and then circulate
them through the capital from there. That way, it'll
be harder to figure out where they're coming from.
What do you think, Mr. Smith?

It took time to create the printing plate, but it's
quite something, isn't it?
Hm...
He compares the two bills.

Pray tell. Can you figure out which of the two bills
is real?
Heh.
(Damn. I don't have a clue.)

(But this is a situation where a Super Elite Agent
should be able to pick up on even the tiniest of
discrepancies.)

(By enhancing my vision to crazy levels, I finally
catch them. The quality of the paper, the consistency
of the ink, and the printing are all ever so slightly
different.)

(But there's still a problem... I don't remember what
the originals are supposed to be like.)
(It's okay, though.)

(At times like this, it's important to be confident
in your ability to bluff your way through.)
Do I even need to say?
*gasp*
Yukime's eyes are fixed on the bills.
When you compare the two, one's paper is coarser.

There's a difference in the ink bleed too. And do I
need to explain to you what printing misalignment is?
You're right...! I was certain we checked that!

Is there really any need for me to say...which one is
fake?
No.

It goes without saying that the one with more
inaccuracies...
...is the fake—
...is the real one.
Huh?
Huh?

In trying to perfect it, it would appear you
surpassed the quality of the real one.
An oversight on my part. Should we remake them?
That won't be necessary.

I doubt anyone but me would have spotted the
discrepancies.

I am no match for you, it would seem, Mr. Smith. Shall
we begin distributing them tomorrow without delay,
then?
Good.

As we release more counterfeits, they will launch an
investigation. I trust you can handle putting an end
to it.
However—

Yukime’s sentence trails off, as though she's having
trouble getting the words out.
That man... Gettan, I want...
...revenge?
Gettan stole everything from me...
My mother, my friends, everyone in my village...

Now, it is my turn to take everything from him.
Only then shall he die...
You'll have your revenge.

But take care, or it'll consume you and lead you
astray from your path.
